s.text: Army buddies say he took some risks, but was kept out of harm's way by Army brass and never saw combat.
True to character, Gore struggled with his decision for many months in the summer of 1969, seeking the counsel of his father, his friends, and a professor.
With his father seeking re-election to his Senate seat that fall, Gore Jr. enlisted in the Army and served as a reporter.
